newsitem.title: USA: Salomon turned Q3 net equity trading loss.
newsitem.headline: Salomon turned Q3 net equity trading loss.

text.p: Salomon Inc's third quarter net equity sales and trading revenues fell into negative territory in the third quarter, pulling overall results at the firm well below second quarter and year-ago levels.

Salomon said net equity sales and trading revenues registered a loss of $26 million in the third quarter compared with a $268 million profit in the second quarter. Salomon's third quarter fixed income sales and trading revenues fell to $598 million from $706 in the second quarter.

"While quarter-to-quarter trading results are variable, overal Salomon Inc results for the first nine months of 1996 ($679 million net income) and the latest 12 months ($847 million net income) are very strong," said Salomon Chairman and Chief Executive Robert Denham in a statement.

Salomon said its third quarter net income was $176 million compared with $525 million in the second quarter. It also said that Phibro income rose to $7 million in the third quarter versus a $17 million loss in the second quarter. Basic Petroleum had a loss of $46 million versus a loss of $13 million in the second quarter.
The firm's third quarter global investment banking revenues fell to $187 million from $251 million in the second quarter.

In August, Basis' Residfiner/ROSE unit complex became operational at it Texas City refinery. Basis estimates that its pretax loss would have beem reduced by $20 million to $25 million assuming the operation of a fully optimized Residfiner/ROSE unit complext for the entire quarter.

Corporate and other includes a pretax gain of $48 million or $31 million after tax resulting from the third quarter sale of The Mortgage Corporation Limited and its affiliates to First National Building Society of Ireland.
